summary: This bill, the Demonstrating that Empowerment Makes Opportunities Act (DEMO Act), aims to provide grants for demonstration projects that offer education and training in health professions for individuals with arrest or conviction records. These projects will focus on occupations facing labor shortages and high demand. The bill amends the Social Security Act to authorize these grants, outlining application requirements, preferences, support provided (including legal assistance), and evaluation processes. It also appropriates $10 million for fiscal year 2026 to carry out these programs, with an effective date of October 1, 2025.
